main event: A radar signal was detected at McChord AFB, Washington, on June 6, 1957, indicating the presence of an unidentified flying object.
interesting points: The radar signal was clear and lasted for 53 minutes., The object was suspected to be a deflated balloon at approximately 2,000 feet., The object was lost in ground clutter during the observation., A T-33 aircraft was diverted from McChord AFB for investigation but no sighting was made., Various conclusions pointed towards the object being a balloon, possibly aircraft, or astronomical in nature.
sighted object: one radar signal indicating an unidentified object
witness description: CAPT Raymond Robertson and A/IC James Bowen from the 635th ACW Squadron.
